intro: Gaussia portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Gaussia portoricensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance in its native habitat.
